channel.description: Recent content in Machine Learning on

item.title: Reinforcement Learning: Foundations and Key Concepts
item.description: Supervised learning needs labeled data. What if there’s no teacher? RL learns from interaction - take actions, observe outcomes, maximize reward.

item.title: Markov Chains: Predicting the Future from the Present
item.description: “The future depends only on the present, not on how we got here.

item.title: How to Measure Uncertainty: Entropy
item.description: How uncertain is a distribution? Entropy measures that. High entropy = hard to predict.

item.title: Bag of Words: Still the Simplest Text Representation
item.description: Before embeddings there was Bag of Words. Still useful, still relevant for some tasks.

item.title: How Neural Networks Learn: Gradient Descent
item.description: How does a neural network learn? It adjusts its weights to make better predictions.

item.title: Linear Regression: The Foundation of Machine Learning
item.description: Before deep learning there was linear regression. Still the most useful model for many problems.

item.title: Spearman Correlation for Ranking Relationships
item.description: Pearson correlation measures linear relationships. Spearman measures monotonic ones. If X goes up, does Y tend to go up?

item.title: Cosine Similarity: Why Direction Matters More Than Magnitude
item.description: Two embeddings point in similar direction? They’re similar. Cosine similarity ignores magnitude, only cares about angle.

item.title: Probability Distributions: The Shapes of Randomness
item.description: ML is full of probability distributions. Knowing when to use which one matters.
